intro: Mentha × nepetoides, commonly known as catnip, is a hybrid mint species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a serrated edge. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers arranged in whorled clusters. It is known for its strong aromatic properties, primarily due to the presence of nepetalactone. This species is often cultivated for its medicinal and aromatic uses, as well as for its ability to attract beneficial insects.
